newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat says new Marea model has 70,000 orders.
newsitem.headline: Fiat says new Marea model has 70,000 orders.

text.p: Fiat Auto managing director Roberto Testore said he was satisfied with the car market's welcome for the group's new Marea model.
"We already have orders for 70,000 vehicles," he told reporters while attending the opening of the Bologna Motor Show.
The Marea, Fiat's latest medium to large model in the 1,600/2,000 cc range, was launched in mid-September.
Testore, who earlier said he was generally pessimistic about the trend in the Italian car market, said Fiat Auto's market share was holding up. "November went well for us," he said.
Official data on Italian new car registrations for November are due to be published on December 10.
In October, Fiat marques had a total Italian market share of 43.01 percent against 42.16 percent in September.
